content.description: Obvious trailside boulder with crazy features climb to spooky top out
content.location: First slab boulder right off the trail at start of climbers trail

content.description: Sit low in crack then reach left to rail and traverse left to point at the top
content.location: Last boulder

content.description: This is the original line first sent by Ray Weber.Start in the jug under the right arete and climb the perfect sloping features up the arete to victory.
content.location: Right arete of Slip & Slide boulder.

content.description: Start on the bottom left side of the hollowed out face in chest height juggy pockets and climb up and right, using the right arete to navigate the tricky top sequence.
content.location: On the Slip & Slide boulder

content.description: Start same jug as “Banana Nut Bread” up out of overhang to the left to top
content.location: Same as “Blueberry Muffin”

content.description: Sit start low on jug climb short arete to sloper top
content.location: Last developed boulder along climber’s trail

content.description: Stand start on slab left of arete climb slab to top!  Really fun for the grade…
content.location: Past “Blueberry Muffin” area

content.description: Sit start under left side of obvious ledge and work up to “Keyhole” and finish on slopers at top
content.location: Left side of “Keyhole boulder”

content.description: Sit start in Ohio jug pocket and climb straight up dirty slab to a hand jam at top
content.location: Same as “Eye Contact”

content.description: This is my favorite line at Bell ridge!  Sit start low in small cave on large sidepull jug move left to pocket and edge on face and use edges, crimps and arete to the top
content.location: Near “Trailside Show” (walk further down climbers trail) find boulder with obvious arete at top last problem before you drop down into small drainage heading towards the rest of the area

content.description: Sit start using left hand on arete and right on pinch crimp bump up through edges on arete and holds on face right of arete and top out left side of arete
content.location: Obvious arete on high noon boulder!  This is the first stand alone boulder you see above the main trail when coming into the boulders.  Follow climber’s path for 20 feet and turn uphill back towards this boulder!

content.description: Sit under obvious Ohio jug pocket go left to slab face.
content.location: Another problem further along climber’s trail obvious featured arete past “Slip and Slide”

content.description: Slabby face right of short arete!  Nice chill line…
content.location: Just past “Blueberry Muffin” area

content.description: Climb Downwind Destruction, but after the long deadpoint to the jug, move right and top out using the mini arete. Almost all the fun of the direct, but none of the scary topout. The top moves on this variation are secure and you're not nearly as high up.
content.location: On the face of the Downwind Destruction boulder.

content.description: Start low on jugs in the center of the boulder and climb directly up the obvious line of weakness through a big deadpoint, and then decide whether you want to trust a terrible sloping edge, or get buck and throw a big dyno to the lip.
content.location: In the center of the tall face.

content.description: Sit start low left side of small overhang climb up through jugs to point on lip and get “crafty” on the finish
content.location: Same boulder but left of “Airmail” in small overhang

content.description: Sit start under “brow” feature climb to top very short line!
content.location: Last boulder

content.description: Sit low under roof on underclings reach out right to golden crimp edge and up blunt rounded arete on right side of boulder.
content.location: A little further down the climber’s trail past obvious low cave.

content.description: Sit start under roof on jugs near small tree gain face to right on crimps follow crimps to top
content.location: Same as Blueberry Muffin

content.description: Stand start and use underclings to gain sloper ledge for feet and reach for high obvious letterbox and finish straight up
content.location: Small exposed cliff band near the high noon boulder (see obvious letterbox hold 3/4 way up)

content.description: Decent selection of quality problems all within about a half mile or less from the parking area.All the boulders are trailside on the right, so they are sorted in order of what you will pass first.
